 Addressing other game developers ..


 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is a game that has simply phenomenally fallen in love with more than one million players from around the globe.  The game is a direct continuation of part 2 - The Witcher 2: Assassin of Kings.  The game was developed by the same Polish studio CD PROJECT RED.  And I must say that the guys from CD Project jumped clearly above their heads.  By the way, it is worth noting that the new story about the adventures of Geralt from Rivia won more than a dozen prizes and competitive nominations.  And even now, 5 years after the release, the game still remains in the TOP of sales and consistently totals 25k people who play it daily.  Well, let's look at what kind of merit, the game has such a high popularity in the gaming community and help people who still, for some unknown reasons, have not passed this game and are in thought with buying it.

 Prologue

 Geralt and Wesemir in search of Yennifer stop in the village of White Garden, occupied by the Nilfgaards during the war.  Yennifer helps Geralt get to the city of Vizima, where the Nilfgaard emperor Emgyr Var Emreis instructs the witcher to find Ciri - for this purpose Geralt must visit several places: Velen, Novigrad and Skellige Islands.

 Plot

 To begin with, it is worth noting that part 3 of the Witcher series of games has the longest storyline.  At SpeedRun, all possible quests will take you + -25 hours of play.  If you pass the game for the first time and slowly, then it can take you about 100 hours to complete it, well, if with all the additional quests, then it‚Äôs 150 hours, if you decide to go through all the add-ons, you‚Äôll need + -200  hours ... Now let's list the main advantages of the game:

 - An interesting storyline with a lot of plot twists.  Although, at first, it can be boring, but only at first;

 - A lot of additional quests.  Moreover, these quests in places give odds to quests of the original storyline.

 - Variability and replayability of the plot.  In the game, we will more than once have to make decisions on which in the future, based on our choice, certain consequences and further events of the game will depend (This feature applies to additional quests too);

 - A detailed lore of the game.  Notes, books, letters, notes about monsters, legends and the like.  It is important to note here that all this is very interesting to read.

 - A huge number of memorable characters.

 Of the shortcomings, I would only note a boring complication, and as a whole, an excellent plot.  10 Geralts from Rivia out of 10.

 Gameplay

 The gameplay in the third part at first glance may seem too boring and complicated, but I assure you that after 5-10 hours of the game, you will understand that the gameplay of the game is simple to the point.  Yes, and almost unchanged since 2011.  And now let's briefly go over its features:


 - A completely open world with various regions inhabited by unique peoples.  As the developers assure us, in order to overcome the mainland along the horse, it will take more than 40 minutes of the present

 - Kraft system and Alchemy.  Our GG, with special desire and due dexterity, can weld or rivet anything to itself, naturally, in the presence of one or another recipe / drawing;

 - Just a huge abundance of various opponents and unique ways to deal with each of them;

 - A modest arsenal of knives, offset by a variety of superpowers of the protagonist in the field of magic and witchcraft.  With a successful combination, you can easily destroy one or another enemy;

 - An exciting and painfully simple, card game Gwint.  which has become a kind of hallmark of the game.  For this mini-game, it will also take you about two to three dozen hours.

 - A bunch of variations in terms of pumping the main character;

 - Customization of your character.  Anyway, but it is still present in the game;

 - Simple controls.

 Perhaps the only drawback of the gameplay component, I would note a large expenditure of time on a ride between quests.  It‚Äôs boring to ride, and sometimes it takes a very long time to ride, which in turn is very exhausting.  Fortunately, random events and a quick journey, which is available after exploring a particular region, save us.  Most of my shortcomings were not revealed.  And my assessment of the gameplay of this game is 9.5 Jennifer from Wengerberg of 10.

 Graphic arts

 The third part of the Witcher franchise, was developed on its own updated engine REDengine.  And here it must be said that the games of the Witcher series have always been famous for beautiful graphics.  The third part was no exception.  I can‚Äôt say that the graphics in the game are just so cinematic, but nevertheless, she will be able to please you with a huge number of competently staged, in terms of staging cut scenes, without any problems.  Among the shortcomings, I would note a meager supply of facial models for secondary NPCs.  Sometimes it happens that the same model of face can be a blacksmith in Podlessie, a military ambassador in Vyzima, and even a sorcerer.  For a AAA-class project, this is such a thing ... And so, the graphics in the game are beautiful, you can make a bunch of beautiful screenshots, I rate the graphics of the game at 9 Ivasiks out of 10.

 Atmosphere and Sound

 The atmosphere and setting in all the games of The Witcher series has always been a mixture of the Epochs of the end of the Middle Ages and Polish folklore.  .  The atmosphere is executed at the highest level, design and locations, monsters and ordinary people, just magnificent and perfectly characterizes the whole way of life and the essence of people's lives, in that era.  I want to believe the atmosphere of the game, when the game wants to show horror, you really experience it, when the game wants to scare, you really get scared.  Believe me, not every game can cling to the player with its trump atmosphere as the third part.  I have not seen such a detailed atmosphere and setting in any game.  Definitely 10 Ciri out of 10. You need to play this yourself.

 You can not say about the sound.  And the problem here lies not in the soundtrack itself, but in the reproduction of sound in dialogs.  It just so happened that in the Polish and Russian versions of the game, the characters in some places speak acceleratedly, and in some they are too slow.  In the English version, surprisingly, there are no such problems.  But the most interesting is that even 5 years after the release of the game, no one has yet to solve this problem.  Therefore, I basically do not give high marks to the soundtrack of the game, even despite the excellent soundtrack.  7 Keir Metz out of 10.

 Other reviews in my performance.

 Total

 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is a game that everyone should definitely play.  And yes, the game is worth the money.  And besides, lately, discounts

Great visuals after update. It feels like I'm playing a brand new game again. I thought I would hate the new zoomed in camera, but I'm actually enjoying it. You notice a lot more detail as well. Although, I am debating going back to the default one just for combat. If you play on higher difficulties you'll get hit from the back if you're not careful and lose a ton of HP.  Collecting plants is more easy and simple without having to open the loot menu, you can just grab them even when running at full speed. Speaking of running, I've noticed your stamina bar doesn't diminish anymore when sprinting, which is a giant bonus. A lot of other good changes that I won't spoil. Overall it's a pretty good update. If you get poor performance play on DirectX11 and turn down foliage draw distance to medium. /

I went into The Witcher 3 having already played the first two, but you do not need to play the other two. If you are hesitant to get it because you wont know who anyone is, the game has a great feature where you can read about every single character you meet. The beginning in my opinion is a little slow, but it quickly picks up speed and you are hurled into a rich and story driven world filled with endless tasks to keep you busy with. I have put in hundreds of hours and every time I come back I manage to find something new to do. Not only do I highly recommend the base game, but also the DLC. CD Projekt Red has set the standard for DLC. They released over a dozen free dlcs from different outfits and other cosmetics to new and fun missions. Both of the DLC packs add at the very least 30 hours and that is if you take the time to explore very little. If you are even slightly considering buying it, now is a perfect time as the game of the year addition is available practically everywhere for a great price and the free next gen update has already been released. It was also recently announced that more mod tools will be released soon which will breathe some fresh air into the modding scene for the game.

The Witcher III is arguably the best RPG ever made. Captivating story, graphics that still looks good, fleshed-out characters, memorable quests with various choices (things are rarely black or white - more often shades of gray) and an immersive world that keeps you wanting to play more and more.
If you still haven't played it... do it NOW. You won't regret it.
Play it, that's it, you wont regret it.

I'll be honest with everyone here. I start-stopped The Witcher 3 a few times before finally sticking to my guns and actually learning the game and letting it weave me a story.

I was initially put off by how 'clunky' the game felt and how weird the combat was, until i decided to actually git gud at it.

The combat actually has an ebb and flow to it, trying to fight the current by spamming light attacks or heavy attacks will leave you bruised up and weak. You'll need to learn how to fight with the flow, over time you can chain flurry of strikes and dodges with well timed bombs and sign usage. I absolutely love this combat.

The story is actually insane. Instead of following the storyline area timing, Velen, Novigrad then Skellige. You can go Skellige, Novigrad and Velen. The storyline will change itself accordingly and you will definitely miss out a few quests, but your character and those around him will react accordingly! Side with the mad-king and you'll end up with a bad time, choose the warrior hot-head and you'll get a warmonger. Choose the incorrect answers to a mystery, and you may just let the killer escape and it will be YOUR fault.

My only gripe is that the equipment level does not scale save for two swords. You will need to go off the beaten paths and collect 'Witcher Gear' which are heaps above the regular high-tier random equipment you can have. The saving grace is that higher tier 'Witcher Gear' changes appearance based on their tier. The Griffin Armor at top tier looks so much different compared to the base version. It has more usable armor appearance, chainmail here and there, more padding at vulnerable areas.

In my world of great RPG's. I think The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt stands alongside greats like Read Dead Redemption 2, Final Fantasy Crisis Core, and Baldur's Gate 3 for example.

Honestly 10/10. Nothing is perfect in this world, but this game is a solid step beneath it.
